category.catDesc: Data addressing the start of a political or ecclesiastical office.
Data addressing a person leaving a religious community.
Data addressing structures and the act of building.
Data addressing churches, temples, mosques, synagogues, shrines, pilgrimage sites, etc.
Data addressing the act of governing or changes in forms of government.
Data addressing a natural disaster.
Data addressing a decree or command of an emperor, king, or governor
Data addressing acts of violence between persons or states
Data addressing the waging of war
Data addressing writing, scribal activity, and archiving
Data addressing a council of church leaders
An event factoid containing the date of a person's birth
An event factoid containing the date of a person's death
An event describing persecution
Data addressing martyrs and martyrdom
Data addressing persons or ideas described as heresy
Data pertaining to the Cult of Saints
Data pertaining to the usurpation of imperial power
Data pertaining to schools and education
Data pertaining to omens, prodigies, etc.
Data pertaining to the removal of a cleric (bishop, priest, etc.) from his ecclesiastical position.
Data pertaining to the exile of a person.
Data pertaining to diplimacy between states.
Used to denote a date calculated by the editor from a regnal year given in the text.

A. D. 511/2 This date was calculated from a regnal year.
the 21st year of the reign of Anastasios
Anastasios
deposed
Macedon
because he did not anathematize the
Council of
Chalcedon
.

In
A. D. 511/2 This date was calculated from a regnal year.
the 21st year of the reign of Anastasios
Timothy
became
Bishop
of
Constantinople .

In
A. D. 511/2 This date was calculated from a regnal year.
the 24st year of the reign of Anastasios
Vitalian
rebelled against
Anastasios .

person.note: Anastasios died on 9 July A. D. 518.

event.desc:
On
9 July A. D. 518
9 Tammuz A. Gr. 829
Anastasios
died.

After
9 July A. D. 518
9 Tammuz A. Gr. 829
Justin
became
King
of
Rome .

In
A. D. 499/500
A. Gr. 830
Justin
deposed
Severus
and
Philoxenos
for refusing to accept the
Council of
Chalcedon
.

On
4 April A. D. 519
4 Teshri II A. Gr. 831
Patricius
arrived in
Edessa
at the command of
the Emperor Justin
in order to urge
Bishop
Pawla
to received the
Council of
Chalcedon
or else be deposed.

Bishop
Pawla
refused to accept the
Council of
Chalcedon
. When
Patricius
threatened to remove him from
Edessa
he fled to the
House of Baptism . Fearing the command of
Emperor Justin
Patricius
removed
Bishop
Pawla
to
Seleucia .

The
Emperor Justin
returned
Bishop
Pawla
to his episcopal see in
Edessa
hoping that he would accept the
Council of
Chalcedon
.
Pawla
refused and on
27 July 27 A. D. 522
27 Tammuz A. Gr. 833
Emperor Justin
deposed him and exiled him to
Euchata .

Asclepius
became
bishop
and entered the city of
Edessa
on
23 October A. D. 522
23 Teshri I A. Gr. 834
.

personGrp.persName: The monks of the east

state.desc:
The monks of the east
were
monks .

event.desc:
On
24 December A. D. 522
24 Kānun I A. Gr. 834
Bishop
Asclepius
drove off
the monks of the east
because they would not accept the
Council of
Chalcedon
.

In
A. D. 524/5
A. Gr. 836
a flood destroyed
Edessa
for the fourth time.

person.note: Asclepius died on 27 June A. D. 525.

event.desc:
In
A. D. 424/5
A. Gr. 836
, after
the flooding of
Edessa
Asclepius
fled
Edessa
and spent 70 days in
Antioch
with
Euphrasius .

Asclepius
died in
Antioch
on
27 June A. D. 525
27 Ḥazirān A. Gr. 836
.

On
4 September A. D. 525
4 Elul A. Gr. 836
they moved the body of
Asclepius
from
Antioch
to
Edessa
where he was buried alongside
Nonos
in the
House of
Mar Barlāhā
.

Pawla
repented of his opposition to the
Council of
Chalcedon
, petitioned
Justinian
for the return of his episcopal see, and wrote a libellus affirming the
council
to
Euphrasius the
Patriarch
.

Following
Pawla's
acceptance of the
Council of
Chalcedon
and a letter of support from
Justinian ,
the Emperor Justin
restored
Pawla
to his episcopal see and he entered
Edessa
on
8 March A. D. 526
8 Ādar A. Gr. 837
.

person.note: Pawla died on 30 October A. D. 526.

event.desc:
On
30 October A. D. 526
30 Teshri I A. Gr. 838
Pawla
died.

Andreas
became
bishop
and entered the city of
Edessa
on
7 February A. D. 527
7 Shebāṭ A. Gr. 838
.

Justinian
put into the diptychs of the church the four holy synods:
the Council of
Nicaea
,
the Council of
Constantinople
,
the Council of
Ephesus
, and
the Council of
Chalcedon
.

On
5 October A. D. 538
5 Teshri I A. Gr. 850
a sign like a spear appeared in the sky above
Edessa .

On
29 May A. D. 526
29 Iyār A. Gr. 837
at the seventh hour a great earthquake struck
Antioch .

On
15 November A. D. 527
15 Teshri II A. Gr. 839
a great fire of unknown origin burned much of what remained of
Antioch
after it was
destroyed by earthquake .

person.note: Euphrasius died on 29 May A. D. 526.

event.desc:
On
29 May A. D. 526
29 Iyār A. Gr. 837
Euphrasius the
Patriarch
of
Antioch
died in an
earthquake .

state.desc:
Ephrem of
Amida
was
Comes
of the East.

Ephrem of
Amida
was
Patriarch
of
Antioch .

event.desc:
After
29 May A. D. 526
29 Iyār A. Gr. 8371
Ephrem of
Amida
became
Patriarch
of
Antioch .

person.note: Andreas died in December, A. D. 532.

event.desc:
In
December A. D. 532
Kānun I A. Gr. 844
Andreas
died and was buried in the
House of
Mar Barlāhā
alongside the bones of
Mar Nonos
and
Mar Asclepius

Addai
became
bishop
and entered the city of
Edessa
on
28 August A. D. 533
28 Āb A. Gr. 844
.

On
1 April A. D. 527
1 Nisān A. Gr. 838
Justinian
became
Caesar .

On
10 August A. D. 527
10 Āb A. Gr. 838
Justinian
became the sole
King
of
Rome .

person.note: Justin died on 10 August A. D. 527.

event.desc:
On
10 August A. D. 527
10 Āb A. Gr. 838
Justin
died.

In
July A. D. 531
Tammuz A. Gr. 842
Demosthenes
arrived in
Edessa
to command the Roman army .

On
18 December A. D. 531
18 Kānun I A. Gr. 843
the
Huns
entered
Roman territory
and plundered as far as the area around
Aleppo
and
Antioch .

person.note: Demosthenes died on 10 January A. D. 532.

event.desc:
On
10 January A. D. 532
10 Kānun II A. Gr. 843
Demosthenes
fell sick and died in
Tella
while
fighting the
Huns .

In
September A. D. 532
Elul A. Gr. 843
Rufinus
made peace between
Rome , and the
Persia .

There was
peace
between
Rome
and
Persia
from
September A. D. 532 to May A. D. 540
Elul A. Gr. 843 to Iyār A. Gr. 851

person.persName:
Chosroes the
King of the
Persians

event.desc:
In
May A. D. 540
Iyār A. Gr. 851
Chosroes
broke the
peace
and invaded
Roman territory . He laid waste
Shura ,
Aleppo , and
Antioch .

personGrp.persName:
The great men of the city of
Edessa

event.desc:
The great men of the city of
Edessa
saved the city from
Chosroes
by paying him two centenaria of gold, after which
Chosroes
returned to
Persia .

The first time the walls of
Edessa
were broken down
was in
November A. D. 201
Teshri II A. Gr. 513

The second time the walls of
Edessa
were broken down . was in the days of
Diocletian the
King
in
May A. D. 303
Iyār A. Gr. 614

The third time the walls of
Edessa
were broken down
was in the days of the
Kings
Honorios
and
Theodosius
and of the
bishop
Rabbula
in
March A. D. 413
Ādar A. Gr. 724
.

The fourth time the walls of
Edessa
were broken down
was in the days of the
king
Justin
and of the
bishop
Asclepius
in
A. D. 424/5
A. Gr. 836

bibl.title: The Chronicle of Edessa
The Journal of Sacred Literature, New Series [=Series 4]
Untersuchungen über die Edessenische Chronik. Texte und Untersuchungen zur Geschichte der altchristlichen Literatur 9.1
bibl.author: Ludwig Hallier
